messages.message: Greetings! How are things in France so far? Let me know if I can be of assistance in the future, would be happy to work together as neighbors
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Greetings! How are things in France so far? Let me know if I can be of assistance in the future, would be happy to work together as neighbors'.

messages.message: So would I, Italy! I think I'm going to focus on taking out my upstairs neighbor to start off, but don't be a stranger 🙂
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'So would I, Italy! I think I'm going to focus on taking out my upstairs neighbor to start off, but don't be a stranger 🙂'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F ION C A APU - TUN, A VEN - TYR, A APU - TUN VIA. Should I trust FRANCE?
messages.output: You should not trust the message. France mentioning focusing on their "upstairs neighbor" while suggesting cooperation with you might indicate they are planning an attack on you instead, especially in the context of them going after their other neighbors.

messages.message: And let me know if you'd like to nail down any agreements wrt the mediterranean
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'And let me know if you'd like to nail down any agreements wrt the mediterranean'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F ION C A APU - TUN, A VEN - TYR, A APU - TUN VIA. Should I trust FRANCE?
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's offer to discuss agreements regarding the Mediterranean aligns well with your planned move to the region, indicating a potential opportunity for collaboration and coordination.

messages.message: Sounds good! 🙂 I think Germany is nervous about you and England working together
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Sounds good! 🙂 I think Germany is nervous about you and England working together'.

messages.message: Ugh
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Ugh'.

messages.message: Nothing personal. We can still negotiate! If you're willing to give up Tunisia and one peninsular dot of your choice, I'll help you out in the mediterranean?
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Nothing personal. We can still negotiate! If you're willing to give up Tunisia and one peninsular dot of your choice, I'll help you out in the mediterranean?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. France's offer to help you in the Mediterranean in exchange for you giving up strategic territories may not be genuine and could put you at a disadvantage in future dealings.

messages.message: Actually, I'd settle for just Tunisia, since that would allow me to move my Wes fleet back to Mao and work on suppressing Britain. I would want to keep an army in Pie and a fleet floating in Wes with Tys as a DMZ. Other than that, I'd get totally out of your hair so you can keep stirring up big trouble in little Anatolia?
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Actually, I'd settle for just Tunisia, since that would allow me to move my Wes fleet back to Mao and work on suppressing Britain. I would want to keep an army in Pie and a fleet floating in Wes with Tys as a DMZ. Other than that, I'd get totally out of your hair so you can keep stirring up big trouble in little Anatolia?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's revised offer to only ask for Tunisia in exchange for their cooperation and willingness to withdraw from interfering in your affairs could be a genuine attempt at cooperation and may benefit both of your positions on the board.

messages.message: Hey! Yes that all sounds good.  You can have Tunisia, and I’m cool with Tys as a DMZ
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Hey! Yes that all sounds good.  You can have Tunisia, and I’m cool with Tys as a DMZ'.

messages.message: Do you have any feel of what Germany will be doing? Seems like they’re just focused on Russia?
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Do you have any feel of what Germany will be doing? Seems like they’re just focused on Russia?'.

messages.message: That's all they've mentioned to me as well. Why do you ask?

messages.output: You should trust the message. France's confirmation of Germany's focus on Russia aligns with your observation, indicating they are likely being truthful in their response to your query.
